Detailed Description

Class for Puma 560 robots.

The class Puma is the manipulator class of the Puma 560 robot. The class implements all the Puma560 specific functions.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Core Classes
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Tue Feb 06 09:31:06 est 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: Puma.t1.cpp
// Example program for the class Puma.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <conio.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "Puma560.hpp"
#include "TypeInfoT.hpp"
#include "ObjectManager.hpp"
#include "DefaultTrajectoryGenerator.hpp"
#include "SliderTrajectoryGenerator.hpp"

//======================================================================== 
// Puma560.t1.cpp
//========================================================================
// 
// This program shows how to instantiate a Puma560 robot, connect it with 
// a trajectory generator and run it in simulation mode.  
//
//========================================================================
 

//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  if (RoboticPlatform::d_status.isStatusError())
  {
    cout << RoboticPlatform::d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
    RoboticPlatform::d_status.setStatusOk();
    return -1;
  }

  // Instantiate a PUMA 560 robot.
  
  Puma560 leader(1);
  

  sleep(1);
  
  // instantiate trajectory generators and connect it with the PUMA.
  DefaultTrajectoryGenerator<6> tragen;
    
  tragen.setSpeedScale(2);
  tragen.setBlockingMovesOff();

  leader.setTrajectoryGenerator(tragen);
    
  // By Default arm-power is enabled and 
  // simulation is dynamic.
  
  // And let the show begin.... 
  // move the PUMA using the trajectory generator
  
      
  while (1)
  { 
    Vector<6> pos;
    
    pos = 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0;
    tragen.move(pos);
  
    pos = 0, 1.57, -1.57, 0, 0, 0;
    tragen.move(pos);
    
    pos = -1.57, 0.8, -3, 0, 0, 0;
    tragen.move(pos);

  //  pos = 2, 1, 0, 0, -1, 0;
  //  tragen.move(pos);
    
    tragen.stop(0.5);
    tragen.waitForLastRequestCompleted();
      
  }
  

  sleep(5000);
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Puma560 ( const char * objectName )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the object name. If the section in the global configuration file specified by the object name has the class name "Puma560", then the settings of this section are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, identical with the section name in the global configuration file.

Puma560 ( int numInConfig = 1 )
 

This constructor allows you to specify the number of the object in the global configuration file that specifies the class name "Puma560". The settings of this object in the global configuration are used to setup the object.

Parameters:
numInConfig   Number of the object in the global configuration file (only objects of the correct class type are counted), starting at "1".

Puma560 ( const TypeInfo * parent ) [protected]
 

The constructor initializes class variables. This constructor is only called from the constructor of a derived class.

~Puma560 ( ) [virtual]
 

The destructor cleans up memory.

true if the encoder on the joint given by numJoint is at the index position.

This function registers the Qmotor ControlProgram log variables and control parameters specific to this class.

void outputInfo ( ostream & stream = cout ) [virtual]
 

Outputs information about the object to an output stream. This class adds information specific to the Puma.

Parameters:
stream   Stream to output the information to.

Reimplemented from DefaultManipulator.

void reset ( ) [virtual]
 

This function resets parameters such as those of the potentiometer filter. This function is called in the startControl() function of the Qmotor ControlProgram (DefaultManipulator)

Reimplemented from DefaultManipulator.

Vector< 6 > readJointPosition<6> ( ) [virtual]
 

This function calculates the joint positions of the Puma taking the joint coupling factors into consideration.

Reimplemented from DefaultManipulator.

void calibrateJointPosition ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition ) [virtual]
 

Calibrates the manipulator by defining a certain position to be the current position that the manipulator is in. The new position overwrites the current position. This function should not be called while the manipulator is in movement. When reimplementing this function, a derived class must assure that using this function does not result in undesired movements of the manipulator, i.e. any connected servo control must be informed about the calibration as well as trajectory generators.

Parameters:
jointPosition   New manipulator joint position(radians).

Reimplemented from DefaultManipulator.

void readGlobalConfiguration ( Config * config ) [virtual]
 

This function is used to read custom settings from the configuration file.

Reimplemented from DefaultManipulator.

TypeInfoT< Puma560 > s_typeInfo [static]
